name: Attachment
description: Represents a file that a user can attach to a parent object record.
summary:
The **Attachment** object in Salesforce is used to store files that are attached to records. It includes various attributes to describe the attachment and its metadata. Here is a summary of its attributes:

1. **Id (id)**: A unique identifier for the attachment.
2. **IsDeleted (boolean)**: Indicates whether the attachment has been deleted.
3. **ParentId (reference)**: The ID of the parent record to which the attachment is linked.
4. **Name (string)**: The name of the attachment file.
5. **IsPrivate (boolean)**: Indicates whether the attachment is private.
6. **ContentType (string)**: The MIME type of the attachment file.
7. **BodyLength (int)**: The size of the attachment in bytes.
8. **Body (base64)**: The actual content of the attachment, encoded in base64.
9. **OwnerId (reference)**: The ID of the user who owns the attachment.
10. **CreatedDate (datetime)**: The date and time when the attachment was created.
11. **CreatedById (reference)**: The ID of the user who created the attachment.
12. **LastModifiedDate (datetime)**: The date and time when the attachment was last modified.
13. **LastModifiedById (reference)**: The ID of the user who last modified the attachment.
14. **SystemModstamp (datetime)**: The date and time when the attachment was last modified by a system process.
15. **Description (textarea)**: A description or additional information about the attachment.

This object is essential for associating files with various Salesforce records, providing additional context and documentation to support business processes.
label: Attachment
